verses.name: Dionysius: Of the One Substance 1:3
verses.text: The plant that springs from the root is something distinct from that whence it grows up; and yet it is of one nature with it.

verses.name: Dionysius: Of the One Substance 1:4
verses.text: And the river which flows from the fountain is something distinct from the fountain.

verses.name: Dionysius: Of the One Substance 1:5
verses.text: For we cannot call either the river a fountain, or the fountain a river.

verses.name: Dionysius: Of the One Substance 1:6
verses.text: Nevertheless we allow that they are both one according to nature, and also one in substance; and we admit that the fountain may be conceived of as father, and that the river is what is begotten of the fountain.
